cards.front: {{c1::Async}} functions allow code to run without blocking the {{c2::main thread}}, enabling better performance.
A {{c1::callback}} function is passed as an argument to another function and executed {{c2::later}}, often used in asynchronous operations.
The {{c1::DOM}} ({{c2::Document Object Model}}) represents the structure of HTML documents as a tree of objects.
{{c1::REST}} stands for {{c2::Representational State Transfer}}, an architectural style for web APIs.
In Object-Oriented Programming, {{c1::encapsulation}} means bundling data and methods that operate on that data within a {{c2::single unit}}.
{{c1::Git}} is a {{c2::distributed}} version control system used for tracking changes in source code.
A {{c1::SQL injection}} attack occurs when malicious {{c2::SQL code}} is inserted into application queries.
{{c1::CI/CD}} stands for {{c2::Continuous Integration}} and {{c3::Continuous Deployment}}, automating the software delivery process.
In agile methodology, a {{c1::sprint}} is a time-boxed period, typically {{c2::2-4 weeks}}, for completing a set amount of work.
{{c1::Docker}} is a platform that uses {{c2::containerization}} to package applications with their dependencies.
